title: Is Amerigo Vespucci revered in American history? - Quora
tags: Presidential History of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I would say that most people would not know who he is. I remember that they mentioned him once in 7th or 8th grade history as a mapmaker. I didn’t run into him again until I got to college. For whatever reason, Italian-Americans chose Christopher Columbus as their standard bearer. Most of the country even used to celebrate Columbus Day. I would say that Columbus and John Cabot (Giovanni Caboto) are better known.
Revered? No. He is the answer to the trivia question, “How did the Americas get their name?”
